metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000127 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
memcached version prior to 1.4.37 contains an Integer Overflowvulnerability in items.c:item_free() that can result in data corruption anddeadlocks due to items existing in hash table being reused from free list.This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity to thememcached service. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 1.4.37and later.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000127` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

memcached - 1.4.25-2ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: memcached package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.25-2ubuntu1.4').
